content.description:
Reaction <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>X</mtext></math>: <math alttext="Carbon with mass number 14 and atomic number 6 decays into Nitrogen with mass number 14 and atomic number 7, plus an electron particle, plus an antineutrino" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mmultiscripts><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>6</mn><mn>14</mn></mmultiscripts><mo>→</mo><mmultiscripts><mtext>N</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>7</mn><mn>14</mn></mmultiscripts><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>-</mo></msup><mo>+</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>v</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover></math>Reaction <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>: <math alttext="Fluorine with mass number 18 and atomic number 9 decays into Oxygen with mass number 18 and atomic number 8, plus a positron particle, plus a neutrino" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mmultiscripts><mtext>F</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>9</mn><mn>18</mn></mmultiscripts><mo>→</mo><mmultiscripts><mtext>O</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>8</mn><mn>18</mn></mmultiscripts><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>v</mi></math>
Nuclear reactions <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>X</mtext></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> are represented.
content.question:
Consider Reaction <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>.
Which of the following indicates whether the number of protons and whether the number of neutrons is greater for the original, unstable nucleus or for the decay products?
Number of protonsNumber of neutronsAOriginal nucleusOriginal nucleusBOriginal nucleusDecay productsCDecay productsOriginal nucleusDDecay productsDecay products

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
